section.title: Who is this guide for?
section.para: This guide is for users of the OTHERobjects CMS. You wil already have a working site installed and built. This guide will cover the management or the site and it's content.

chapter.title: What is OTHERobects?
chapter.para: [Brief overview of what a CMS is and how it works]

section.title: Link library
section.para: You can put links in without using the library. This is preferred for links that are not used more than once. Advantages: easily change + easily select.

section.title: Publishing/Unpublishing task
section.para: This OO task is run automatically, publishing all content which has not been published and where the embargo date is before the current date and time (at the moment when the task runs) or is not set, and the expiry date is after the current date and time or is not set.
This task also unpublishes all expired content, i.e., all published content where the expiry date is set and is <= current date and time.

section.title: Wiki Syntax
section.para: We use a simplified wiki syntax to control the formatting of textual. This has several advantages (realiable cross browser, standards compliant markup, reliable copy and paste, create offline, repuprose as non-HTML).
We use the Textile syntax. A full reference is available here: http://hobix.com/textile/ or see our quick reference card TODO.
The features that are not supported as of July 2009 are:

listitem.para: Some entity replacement doesn't work (eg dashes, elipsis, smart quotes)
Alt text on images is buggy
Link aliases work but leave the link definition visible

sect1.title: Running Jobs
sect1.para: On the debug view, specifically /otherobjects/debug/scheduler, you can see the currently active job triggers and running jobs.
Triggers can be stopped and restarted, preventing or scheduling the next fire of the job.
